"Well, remember how you warned me what would happen without my suit's waste management systems?"

"Alright Tali. You can get yourself cleaned up, but I would like to offer you something that might help you. It is called a diaper. I'm sure you have heard of it. 123.content:
Tali clutched her stomach as she ran to the bathroom for the eighth time today, feeling pressure building up within her lower gut; It was rounded, almost taut with the sheer volume of fecal matter packed within, just begging to escape through her tight, purple butthole. Not so tight anymore, now that the infection was upon her and even these basic muscle controls were weakening. It felt like her intestines were on fire, and though the bathroom door was only a few steps away, she just couldn't hold it in. The quarian moaned in misery as shit flooded her diaper, the plastic crinkling beneath her suit as it expanded. The hiss of piss was loud in her ears, amid a chorus of groans and grunts as she tried in vain to keep her overloaded bowels from emptying themselves.

"Gradual atrophy of the muscles in the lower gastro-intestinal tract, as well as those controlling bladder release. Expected outcome: Total incontinence within 36 hours. Barring total gastro-uric transplant, effects almost certainly permanent." That's what Mordin had told her, back when this all started. She was just walking through the Normandy, minding her own business, when her stomach suddenly lit up with pain, and she doubled over as a sudden wave of diarrhea flowed into her suit, collecting around her ankles like a mushy, foul soup. There was no way to hide her shame, surrounded by the whole crew, and it was Garrus who hauled the panicking quarian into Mordin's lab. All it took was a simple stool test to prove that she'd caught something rather... Embarrassing: Scale itch, a non-fatal infection caused by sexual contact with varren, those weird reptilian dogs from Tuchanka. In varren, it produced effects of itchy scales and ugly rashes; In quarians, it seemed to mostly affect the digestive system. She knew she was lucky the effects hadn't been worse, but at the same time, constantly crapping and pissing herself was hardly part of her lifelong aspirations.

"K-Keelah," She muttered as she finally made it through the bathroom door, unzipping her suit and slamming her muddy ass down on the toilet, but the episode had already ended, leaving her with an aching anus and a heavily soiled diaper to clean. Even empty, the diaper made her ass look twice as big as before, and more than one horny krogan had given it a squeeze, and grunted in confusion as her 'butt' crunched beneath his fingers. After a good filling like this one, it looked even bigger, drooping with what a casual observer might mistake for cellulite. No such luck; It was just a massive load of liquid quarian shit sloshing around within an all-too-flimsy plastic bag. Even with the kevlar reinforcements, she wasn't confident it could hold everything, especially when an ill-timed meal gave her an attack of liquid dookie in public. She didn't want to be a shitbag of a quarian forever, but there was nothing she could do about it. At least her crewmates still treated her normally, with more than a bit of sympathy for her unfortunate new condition. After washing the muck from between her plump purple cheeks, she sprayed herself down with baby powder and climbed into a new diaper. She'd need it, since she had to...
123.title: Non-lethal Infection

1233.content:
Of all her crewmates, only one still showed any interest in her body, and that was Garrus Vakarian. It was so strange, one day they were joking and miming motorboating her perky quarian breasts, and the next, they just gave her weird glances and plugged their noses. It was almost as if most men were turned off by the sight of a woman with a heavily-used, sagging diaper. Go figure. The turian was always the flirty type, never seeming to care when Tali let loose, and even giving her squishy diaper a good squeeze. While his interests were strange, she appreciated the attention, and when he asked her to visit his cabin later on, she decided to repay the favor. Bringing a spare diaper, just in case, she headed to the turian's spot in the gunnery room.

Before she even reached it, Garrus came up from behind and clamped his hand around her backside, her diaper crinkling loudly. Tali could barely feel it through the padding, but she still yelped in surprise. "Dry as ever, Tali?" He chuckled, wrapping a hand around the quarian's waist. Cheesy as he was, Garrus was earnest, and Tali nodded, a smile hidden beneath her purple-tinted visor. Together, they settled down in his private area, hidden from the rest of the gunnery bay by hanging sheets, and lay on a hydrofoam mattress together. "So," Garrus chuckled, "Are you ready to..?"

"The diaper change can wait. And to the be honest, it doesn't feel half bad. Nice and warm."

With that, she began looking around for any kind of clue as to where she should head to next. She looked at the left path and saw nothing of any worth which would have her continue that way. However, when she looked at the right path, she noticed what looked like weather-faded foot prints.

"If I ever needed anything to help give me direction, foot prints are definitely the way to go."

She began to make her way down said path and began to notice a lot of indicators that this path was being used, frequently. She immediately put the visor down, on her helmet and began to used the thermal-vision setting on it to help her detect any incoming threats. Seeing as the background area was cooler than a person, any exposed or non-thermal-shield part of a person would be easily seen.

As she continued down the path, she heard what sounded like a stick breaking. She began frantically looking around.

"Who's out there?! Show yourself or I will kill you!"

A man in black armor jumped down from a tree and kicked Ashley's rifle out of her hands. She immediately began hand-to-hand combat with him. 15331121221122.content:
Commander Jenny Shepard of the Alliance vessel Normandy - first ever human Spectre and widely-recognized savior of the galaxy - was on the other side of Samara's door. When the door first opened, she had had a small grin on her face. Now the grin had faded into a gaping expression. Evidently, she was both alarmed and stunned by the sight she was presented with then. That was saying quite a bit, considering all the strange, peculiar, and horrifying things she had encountered since that fateful mission to Eden Prime.

Standing in front of her was her friend and former business associate Justicar Samara. She had heard the Justicar was a merciless, modest, strict, disciplined, no-nonsense warrior whose principles could not be changed for anything, and after working with her, the Commander had come to believe as much about Samara.

So when she was confronted with the sight of Samara in absolutely nothing but a very thick white adult diaper, she was flabbergasted. She found she could not even put two words together, and all she could do was stammer "Uh... um... er..."

Samara just smirked, amused at the human woman's bewilderment. "Would you look to come in, Commander?"

Jenny Shepard hastily pulled herself together and managed to say in her usual stern tone "Yes, Justicar. I... I have some business to discuss with you."

Samara nodded her head in acknowledgment and beckoned the Spectre "Come in, please."

Commander Shepard looked over her shoulder first, hoping nobody else had seen them. Then she entered the apartment, and Samara immediately shut the door after her.

Once they were alone, Shepard turned to Samara. She tried to maintain eye contact with her, but it was too difficult, given the Asari's current apparel.

Samara chuckled lightly and placed her hands on the sides of her diapers, and she presumed "I suppose you'd like an explanation for this."

"Well... that would be helpful," Shepard mumbled awkwardly.

"Fair enough," Samara conceded, "But I'd also like to know what brings you here."

"Oh, uh... of course," Shepard affirmed.

When they arrived in the living room, Samara laid down on a couch and made herself comfortable. If the human female did not know better, she would have been inclined to wonder if Samara was trying to entice her. If so, she was doing a fair job so far.

At any rate, Jenny Shepard enlightened Samara on the reason for her arrival: "The Council has spotted some remnants of the Collectors in some solar systems along the Outer Rim. Although the threat of the Reaper invasion has been eliminated for now, there is still some concern that the Collectors may continue to harass and abduct more colonists. As a precautionary measure, Admiral Anderson has commissioned the Normandy to hunt them down and eliminate the last of the Collectors. I have full authority to recruit whoever I'd like for this mission, and I decided I would prefer to have the people who aided me the first time around. That would include you."

Samara lightly grinned and sat up, her diapers rustling softly. She looked Commander Shepard in the eye and told her "I'd be honored to join you, Commander. After what you did for me with Morinth, I am always willing to accompany you on any mission."

Jenny smiled and proclaimed "I knew I could count on you. When can I expect you on the Normandy?"

"When will you be leaving Illium?" Samara queried

"Tomorrow morning," Shepard disclosed, "You can either board the ship then or now, whatever you'd like."

The ship looked exactly as it did when Samara last saw it. Most of the faces she had seen then were accounted for, as well.

The sarcastic but competent helmsman, Jeff "Joker" Moreau was - as usual - at his post in the pilot's seat. He greeted his commanding officer and her Asari companion cordially; they bade him a pleasant day.

As the two females headed down the bridge, Joker noticed that there was a bit of a bulk in Samara's outfit, and her walk was somewhat labored. However, he made no comment; his method of walking had always been awkward and strange. There was no need for him to point out another person's unusual gait.

Samara quickly saw that all of her former colleagues were on the ship, as well: Jacob Taylor, Miranda Lawson, Dr. Mordin Solus, Garrus Vakarian, Thane Krios, Zaeed Massani, Kasumi Goto, Grunt, Legion, Jack, and Tali'Zorah nar Rayya. Some of those had remained with Jenny Shepard after the Collector base had been destroyed. She had methodically sought out and brought back those who had not.

Commander Shepard herself personally escorted Samara to her quarters. She was given the Port Lounge on Deck 2, the same lodgings she had the last time she was on the Normandy.

"Oh, I see now. Don't worry Ms. Chambers, this happens to almost everyone. You should not worry yourself too much."
"Thank you Doctor Chakwas, but I was also curious about something. Is there anything you could do for me? I get the feeling that this was not a one time thing."
"There is one thing, but you may not like it."
"What is it?"

Doctor Chakwas went over to the door and locked while also closing the window shades, to give them privacy. She then went over to a cabinet and unlocked it. She opened it and then kneeled down to get something. When she went to show Kelly, she knew immediately what it was. A diaper.

"I can tell from the look on your face that you are suprised. Well, unfortunately, this is the only option in terms of what I can do for you."
"I guess this will have to do then."

Kelly then got up and walked over to Chakwas and grabbed the diaper from her.

"Do you need any help with putting it on, Ms. Chambers?"
"No thank you. I think I can do it."

With that, Kelly walked into the back room to put on the diaper. Moments later, Kelly emerged from the back room and looked at doctor Chakwas.

"Well?"
"I can hardly even tell you are wearing a diaper."
"Well, that's good, at least."
"Here." said Chakwas handing Kelly a bag. "These are some spare diapers so that you don't have to come here every time you need a change."
"Thank you Doctor Chakwas."

Kelly then went back to her room to put her diapers away. That was when she realized that...
